Name: Puppy Pounders
Description:
Tactical "Miniatures" Rules for Stuffed Animals

This is probably the pre-cursor to Fuzzy Heroes.

From the rules intro:
There she sits, adorable, fuzzy, and as snug as the cat who ate the canary. She knows you can't blame her - she's just too cute. Yet, where did the rest of the stuffed animals disappear to?? All you found were small piles of stuffing and plush material. Your little stuffed dog could not possibly have done all that. Unless, just maybe, she's discovered the rules for that new game you had hidden under the bed. The rules for ... PUPPY POUNDERS

Name: Nickel & Dime Pool
Description:
Nickel & Dime Pool is a dexterity, flicking game based on pool. Coins are used in place of balls. They are "flicked" with your finger instead of using a pool cue. A larger, nickel-sized coin is used as the cue ball and 10 dime-sized coins represent the rest of the balls. The small coins are split into 2 groups, solids and stripes. One player/team uses solids, numbered 1-5, the other uses stripes, numbered 6-10. The goal is to be the first player/team to sink all of their respective coins into the pockets. The board is square, molded plastic with 6 pockets. 1 at each of the 4 corners and 1 one along either side midway down the board. Just like billiards, the cue coin is used to sink the other coins into the pockets by flicking it into the numbered coins.

Game comes with board, 11 coins, plastic triangular rack and vinyl pouch to hold coins. Vinyl decals are supplied to apply to the coins, representing the different numbered balls, 1-10.

Name: Mt Kilajava
Description:
Welcome to the world of Mt. Kilajava, the first board game from Christchurch-based Monsoon Games that combines the spirit of competitive gaming with a rare insight into the realities of  global trade.

You have arrived at the slopes of Mt Kilajava, a bare but fertile volcano, to establish a coffee farm. Your opponent arrives at the same moment, and has the same idea... The race is on! Who can successfully grow more coffee on the land available?

This is a fun, strategy-based board game for two players. Unfolding events maintain the suspense until the very end - storms, eruptions and price crashes will claim a lot of coffee along the way.

Mt. Kilajava also makes an important point; that for farmers in the developing world growing coffee is a very precarious occupation, and slumps in world coffee prices can and do have a catastrophic effect on the lives of millions of growers who are reliant on coffee for their income.

With some skill, daring and a measure of good luck you can enjoy watching your opponent lose their coffee to plummeting world prices.  On the way you will also gain an insight into the real story behind your double shot cappuccino.

"Games first and foremost have to be fun to play, but I think they can also help us better understand and appreciate the world around us," says creator (and Trade Aid coffee buyer) Justin Purser.

Name: Stock ~ Split
Description: Stock ~ Split is an economic game designed to teach players about the stock market. The game board has a slider to keep track of stock prices, allowing for variability between plays. Players move about the board by rolling dice, but different places offer different movement, depending on what was rolled (an even or odd for example.) Players buy and sell stock as the game progresses - there is no credit allowed in the game so if a player runs out of money then he or she is eliminated. The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Ocaso Zombie
Description:
TONIGHT, THE DEAD WALK AGAIN ... THEY ARE HUNGRY FOR YOU!

Fear invades you as you move, unsure of what just lies around the corner... hold your breath, don´t make a noise, yo feel as if the beating of your heart you will delate you, perhaps the next building is safe, or maybe you are haeding towards a trap, but you know you can't stop, you must continue moving forward, looking for a way out.

Explore the city, moving through the zombie infested streets, you will discover the different locations as you go forward; collect weapons that will help you eliminate the hordes of voracious zombies chasing you. look for items that are necesary in your espae in one of the vehicles ... flee before they turn you into another one of the walking dead!

PLAYERS
4 players, ages 12 and older

COMPONENTS
64 playing cards:
    8  characters cards
     22 locations cards
    30 situations/items cards
    4  life points tracking cards
36 zombie counters:
    12 1 zombie counters
    12 3 zombies counters
    12 6 zombies counters
4 life points tracking counters
4 playing pieces
2 dice (not included in the PRINT'n'PLAY version)

OCASO ZOMBIE (ZOMBIE SUNSET)
The goal of the game is to survive the ZOMBIE SUNSET, obtaining the resources needed to use any of the ways out.

The game ends in two ways:
1. All players are killed (If there are no more ALIVE players, the game ends, even if there are still players in ZOMBIE state).
2. All players (ALIVE) escape from the city.

THE CARDS
CHARACTERS:
In them you will find the different features of your character, and some special skills to enhance your offense, defense or other actions.

LOCATIONS:
These are cards that from the game map, in them you will find red arrows that indicate the access points of each locations, you can join the cards together with each other with this access points, allowing you to create a different map for each game.

SITUATIONS AND ITEMS:
In these cards you will find different scenenarios that you must solve to move through the different locations, and you will also

Name: Dorn: Koschei's Eternal Return
Description:
First expansion for the boardgame Dorn.

Koschei the Deathless is the new boss in the Expansion. He moves freely on the board and keeps resurrecting. The heroes need to open the gate and destroy the magical egg where the Koschei keeps his heart.

There are five new heroes to choose from, a druid, a troubadoure, a thief, a psionic and a barbarian. There are also five new hideous monsters to play with. The evil side can also build totems, which cannot move but give bonuses to surrounding monsters.

There are new Treasures, Blessings and Rituals, but also each hero is given a specific personal quest. If he completes it, he gets a special reward. The evil side also has similar quests.

Name: NF's Gourmet
Description:
"Two restaurants are fighting to earn the customer's trust for their food service, the quality of their dishes and the good recipes they are preparing.

5 customers, trying to choose on wich one will stay this night for their dinner.

2 shefs trying to stay calm , to remember where the raw materials are and to suggest a dish from their menu to each customer.

Finally the best restaurant wins the medal of the demanding gastronomic and prospective customer"

A card game for two players that combines sharp mind,strategy and alot of cooking!

3  Table Boards
5  Customers tiles
37 Cards
24 Medal parts
1  Illustrated rule book

Microbadge

 Buy It

Name: Evidence in Action
Description:
The board game, which is similar to Snakes and Ladders, was developed as part of the World Health Organization evidence-based reproductive health care training package. It is an innovative and creative method, which enables participants to put into action the knowledge gained from a preceding training workshop. It can also be used as a stand-alone learning tool. The game was developed with a rural setting in mind, highlighting some of the logistical and health-related problems encountered in under-resourced countries
In the game the players need answer correctly the questions about Health Care. 
The game is a roll and move and each position has a question about the theme.

www.mrc.ac.za/cochrane/boardgame.htm

Name: CHem-eO
Description:
A new game from the makers of Booleo, this time covering organic Chemistry.

CHem-eO is a fun card game for two or more players, which demonstrates basic organic chemistry fundamentals. Players compete to build complex and simple compounds from individual atoms.  Points are scored upon completing each molecule.  Players may choose to play to any score they wish - a suggested goal is 92, which is the atomic number of Uranium (the heaviest naturally occurring element).  If the player would like a longer game then an alternate goal could be the atomic number of the heaviest element currently discovered.  Players scores are kept on the periodic table of element.  Play as Carbon(Solid), Oxygen(liquid), Helium(Gas), or Nitrogen(Unknown).

The points scored as players finish building compounds come in two varieties: simple and complex.  Simple compounds are common compounds which are made up of relatively few atoms.  Complex compound are designated as such; either because they consist of more atoms and bonds, or because they are less well known. Complex compounds have the added difficulty of requiring the recipe card to complete.  This also earns the player bonus points.

Once a compound is started it can be completed by any player which means a compound you start out to be Methane (a simple compound) may be turned into Acetic Acid (a complex compound) requiring a recipe.

Cards include single, double and triple bonds, elements, and recipes for compounds.  Play is fast paced and allows the players to learn about organic chemistry while they play this fun interactive game.

Name: Post Office-Opoly Holiday Stamp Edition
Description:
From the Website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Holiday Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Holiday Collection...

Since it’s inception in 1962, millions have enjoyed collecting, sending and receiving cards adorned with the holiday stamps.

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants... or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll!
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Post Office-opoly Love Stamp Edition
Description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying
the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Love Stamps Edition, celebrates the magic of the Love Collection... and who couldn’t use a little more LOVE!

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers...

Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental bulldog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants...

or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll! Ya gotta LOVE it!
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Post Office-opoly Wonders of America Stamp Edition
Description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

The U.S. Postal Service is proud of its role in portraying the American experience to a world audience through postage stamps. U.S. postage stamps magically transport us from sea to sea, from North to South, and everywhere in between!

POST OFFICE-OPOLY, The Wonders of America Stamp Edition, celebrates the spectacular "Wonders of America: Land of Superlatives" Collection...

EXPLORE THE WONDERS COAST TO COAST!

Buy your favorite stamps, build monopolies, and increase your rent by adding Post Offices and Bulk Mail Centers... Sounds easy enough, but throw in some "over the weight limit" packages, over-stuffed mailboxes and a temperamental dog and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

Who knows?!? You may soon find yourself missing the seat of your pants...or you may be elected Postmaster General!

It’s YOUR roll!

What A Wonderful Thing!
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Monster Jam-opoly
Description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

FIRE THAT BAD BOY UP!!!

Climb in and hold on tight for one heckuva game!

It’s all the fun of a traditional property
Trading game with some huge twists!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...
Build your own Monster Jam® fleet of monster trucks.
Buy toolboxes to upgrade your monster trucks & trade them
in to build your dream garage & maximize your fleet’s value!

Watch out for roadblocks to your championship...
Flat tires, oil & methanol refills or a false start! It’s all fun & games until you’re sent to Digger’s Dungeon®& out for 3 turns!

You’ll find the biggest & baddest monster trucks here...
The monster truck titles have fun facts about your favorite drivers & the monster trucks! This game is loud & in your face fun...

So choose your token, fire up your engine & wait for
the green light! Who knows! You may be getting three 10’s
from the judges or you may be SHUT DOWN!

Whatever happens, this is one BIG ride!

Name: Christmas-opoly
Description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas!

Get your lights up, your presents wrapped, gather family and friends, and pop the lid off Christmas-opoly! Watch out Players! You may be run over by a reindeer! Be nice...or you may end up with a lump of coal!

To play, collect Christmas properties, increase your property value by buying presents and trading them in for a Christmas tree. It’s all fun and games until someone blows a fuse, gets snowed in, or gets sent to 'Naughty' and is out of the game for three turns!

Whatever happens YOU BETTER NOT POUT! Christmas-opoly is a game to celebrate the season!

MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL!

Name: Filosofia Cortesana
Description:
Filosofia cortesana de Alonso de Barros
The game squares, numbering up to 63, lead to the ships sailing in the centre of the board on the 'sea of suffering'. The objective is survive and reach the new lands.

The players roll a dice and move your ships reading the information in the squares

Name: Il novo bello et piacevole gioco della scimia
Description:
Published by Altiero Gatti in 1588 featuring numerous monkeys displaying human characteristics.

Game of 63 numbered boxes, spiral, anticlockwise, centripetal that respects the classic rules of the Game of Goose. Geese are replaced by monkeys. Below right the name of the author and the date ("Alittento Gatti formis 1588").

Name: Jagd auf Kohlenklau
Description: Very rare propaganda board game print published by Lepthian-Schiffers in the 1930s that sought to promote economy in the use of raw materials in Germany.

Name: Salvespelet Kalmar 1397
Description:
This game was published for the life size reconstruction of Kalmar, town in south-eastern Sweden, as it was 1397 when the Nordic union was signded.
The players move their pawns around medieval Kalmar. On certain spaces they answer questions in four categories, all with connection to Kalmar and the middle ages. When all categories have been cleared a player may enter Kalmar castle and claim victory.

Name: Primal Rage: Rage On Urth!
Description:
Object: You are one of the Primal Rage Dino Beasts! Use your battle ball to wage war with the other Dino Beasts. Win the Battle and "eat" the Primal Followers!  Eat the most Primal Followers and win the game!

Players first assemble the arena, which uses the actual gamebox and 2 ramps on each of the short sides of the box.  Players then "wager"
their followers (1-4) and place them in the arena on marked spots. Players place one of their 4 special attack features in the appropriate 
spots without looking at them.  Then both players take their Beast's battle ball and roll it from the
tops of the ramp towards the arena floor.
  
Scores are tallied, number  showing on the beast's battle ball + their special attack, and the  winner "eats" all of the followers that were
 knocked down in that round.  Play then rotates to the 2nd player vs. 3rd player, and then 3rd vs. 4th, until all players have had 2 matches each.

The winner of the game is the one with the most "eaten" followers at 
the end of the game.

Name: Historical Medieval Battles
Description:
A book of historical medievals scenarios including maps and orders of battle.  Forty different battles are included: from Tours (732 AD) through Bosworth Field (1485 AD).  Unit descriptions are based on the De Bellis Antiquitatis/Multitudinus (DBA/M) rules.  The author gives the numbers of men represented per stand, so it should be easy to modify to other rules sets.

Example:  Anglo-Danish army at Hastings

"Approximately 10,000 men:
6 Blade I (O), 14 Spear I (I), 1 General (Harold) Blade I (O)

Figure scale:  close = 600 men, loose = 400 men, open = 200 men"

Name: Terre-Air-Mer
Description:
Early abstract wargame for two players or teams.
The board shows land and sea in a 16 by 20 rectangular grid. There are a few features on the map: a harbour, a fort, a town, a capital, an island and three trenches.
The forces are made up of 320 cardboard counters depicting land sea and air units. The units have different movement and fighting capabilities. They have also different point values.
The aim of the game is to capture the opponents capital. If the war is finished earlier by mutual agreement the winner is the one who has destroyed enemy units of a larger total value than the opponent.

Name: TRILOGY
Description:
From the box:

"What is TRILOGY like?

Three groups square off on a triangular battlefield. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents' warriors by strategically attacking them with your men. To accomplish this, you must engage the services of the neutral team (also called the Robot Team). Beware! Because your opponent gains control of the neutral robots on his turn. Both opponents move toward the center power source. Here they many choose to regenerate their forces or decide upon a strategic super attack. Look out! The unseen move can propel you or destroy you. Never give up... comebacks are always possible. Maybe you will be the next TRILOGY master."

Each player gets a team of six markers, and there is a third "team," that is the neutral robot. Each turn, players can move one of their pieces and one of the robot pieces. Pieces can move or jump other pieces. Jumping an opponents' piece or a robot piece eliminates that piece. Moving to the center dot on the board allows a player to generate another piece or take an extra turn. The first player to eliminate the opponent's team wins.

Published by "Ellis and Frazier Games"

Name: Reveal 4
Description:
From the box:

"The makers of Trilogy now bring you an exciting NEW card game of skill, luck, strategy, and memory.

Reveal 4 is a fast moving battle of memories in which individuals or teams match mind power to see who can be the first to "Reveal 4." Watch out! Just when you think you are about to win,  your opponent can cunningly pull the rug out from under you. Rules are included for the basic game and advanced games."

Published by Ellis and Frazier Games

In Reveal 4, two teams of partners are dealt four cards each. First the cards are dealt face up, and then are turned over for no one to see. Players then take turns drawing from the "Trade" pile, which allows them to turn over cards and trade them with other players' cards, as well as mix up theirs or someone else's hand, or trade with the draw pile. When a player thinks (s)he has a complete set of four cards, the player announces it and turns their cards over. If the cards are four of a kind, the player gets a new hand. Otherwise, they lose their next turn. The first team to successfully reveal two complete sets wins.

Name: Tänkolär
Description: Tänkolär ("Think'n'learn") is a game of questions and answers about the bible, and three other areas of knowledge (each area has its own coloured cards). It contains 200 small cards, each with a question and its answer. The rules give thee different ways to play depending on the size of the group 2-4, 2-8 or 8-100. Most correct answers or, in one variant, most points wins the game.

Name: Big Shot
Description:
From the Publisher...

Run the pool table. Your child will have a ball playing with this Ideal Big Shot game.

•Step-by-step instructions and rubber bands teach your child how to set up and do trick shots.
•The ball is shot when your kiddo aims and releases the pool cue ball launcher. 
•Your li'l one can bet against friends with play money to see who is the champ of the table.
•Details: 
•Includes: 2 table pieces, ball launcher, over 30 trick shot cards, rubber bands, balls & play money
•15"H x 6"W x 26"D
•Ages 5 years & up
•For 1 or more players

Billiard styled game by Ideal. Setup the pool table to attempt billiards tricks. Game is played on a hexagon table with rubber band sides. Ball setup is done through trick cards and indentations on the table. The more difficult the trick the more money it is worth. A side betting game is also part of the overall game.

Name: SAS: Spee
Description:
SAS: Spee is a bare-bones rules set for the Supremacy at Sea naval miniatures rules that includes a demo scenario.

The demo scenario included covers the Battle of the River Plate, the first major naval engagement of World War II. This is the clash in which the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee was found and engaged by three smaller Royal Naval cruises - HMS Exeter, HMS Ajax and HMS Achilles.

Re-implements:

    Supremacy at Sea

Name: What Blind Ninjas?
Description:
Each player has sent their ninjas into a room to hunt the enemy ninjas. Unfortunately the ninjas are blind and can only use their amazing sense of hearing to locate enemies.

What Blind Ninjas? is a battleship style game where the players send their blind ninjas out to hunt their opponents ninjas.  Players use deduction and the knowledge of their opponents previous attacks to try to deduce the best location for the next attack.  The last player with a living ninja is the winner.

Materials:

     One Icehouse stash per player.
     For a two player game, each player needs a 4 x 8 grid (half a chess board).
     For a three or four player game, each player needs a 8 x 8 grid (a full chess board).
     A folder or other divider for each player to hide their grid.

Name: Zozzle
Description:
Zozzle challenges players to complete a nine-piece puzzle before any opponent, but players will need a good memory to put all the pieces in the right place.

To start the game, the 45 tiles – five tiles each of nine different images, with the nine images combining to form a 3x3 square – are placed face down and shuffled. On a turn, a player turns over two tiles. If the images match and that player doesn't already have that image in her puzzle, she claims one of the tiles, turns the other face down, and takes another turn. If the images don't match or the player has previously claimed that tile, she turns the two tiles face down and ends her turn. Finish your image before anyone else, and you win.

Name: Seriespelet
Description:
This is a Swedish football (soccer) themed card game for two players from the 1930's.
There are red attack cards and black defense cards. The first player plays an attack card. If the second player has a defense card he can save otherwise the first player scores a goal. The winner of the round (the scoring or saving player) has the next attack. The game ends when all the cards have been played and the winner is the one who has scored most goals.
A variant for four players is also given.

Name: Brottarspelet
Description:
This is a Swedish wrestling themed card game for two to four players from the 1930's.
The cards show different wrestling situations and the points awarded (plus or minus). The players in turn draw a card and places it face up on the table. This continues until each players has five cards. The winner is the player with most points.

Name: Olympiaden
Description:
This is a Swedish card game for two to six players from the 1930's themed around the 1936 Olympic games.
Each card shows an athlete, his nationality, which event he competed in and his result. There are five athletes from each nation (Sweden, Finland, Germany, England, Italy, USA, Japan and Canada. One card shows the Olympic rings and serves as a joker.
The players are dealt five cards each. On her turn the player draws a card from the stock and discards one. The player who first have all five cards of one nation wins the game.

Name: Atlantflygningen
Description:
This is a Swedish card game for two or more players from the 1930's about cross Atlantic flights.
There are four suits each showing an airplane of one nation (Sweden, USA, Germany and Italy) numbered 1-10. The Swedish 8, 9 and 10 show the cities London, Paris and Stockholm. There is also a Catastrophe card.
The The eldest player places chips in three pots representing the three cities and starts the game by playing any card in front of himself. The player who has the next consecutive card plays it and so on. A series can be broken by the Catastrophe card, the player of which starts a new  series as does a player who reaches a 10. Whoever plays one of the city cards takes the corresponding chips unless the catastrophe card has been played in which case the player who first gets rid of all his cards receive one chip from each other player for every card remaining in his hand. The pots remain and added to for the next round.

Name: Lyckonumret 13
Description:
You need luck in this world! But knowledge is also necessary to get on in life - and it's the same with this game.
The board depicts a 68 space track from a river up a slope to the top of the mountain. Thirteen of the spaces are numbered 1-13 and have a subject written next to them, cities, rivers, songs i.a.
If a you land on a numbered space the next player in turn asks you a question on the given subject. If the answer is correct you may roll and move next turn otherwise you must go back one space. On certain spaces you have to answer questions from all other players. The winner is the first one to reach space 13.

Name: Circuito Sideral
Description:
[EN]
Game edited in Spain in the year 1958 and signed by Fagus (designer?).
It is a game for 4 players, though they can play more. 
The winner is the first one in coming to the moon.
The components of the game are:
Two dice of 6 faces, one of them special, a board, four counters and instructions.
[SP]
Juego editado en España en el año 1958 y firmado por Fagus (diseñador?).
Es un juego para 4 jugadores, aunque pueden jugar más. 
El ganador es el primero en llegar a la luna.
Los componentes del juego son:
Dos dados de 6 caras, uno de ellos especial, un tablero, cuatro fichas y un folleto de instrucciones.

Name: I ask you answer
Description:
A Swedish card-game for any boys and girls learning English.
The game consists of 50 cards half of which have four questions printed on them (e.g. Where can I meet you next time? Can you lend me ten shilling?) the other half have four answers (e.g. My poor little head! I'm afraid you will be angry with me if I tell you).
Each player gets an equal number of each kind of card. On your turn you ask question number 1 on one of your question cards to any other player who has to use answer number 1 from one of her answer cards. The effect can be hilarious. Continue until all questions and answers have been used.  There is no winner. the aim is to get familiar with the English language.

Name: Toc Toc Toc à la rescousse de la Grubule
Description:
Snakes & Ladders variant with children tv show theme.  Get to the last square (no50) before Mr Craquepoutte and everyone wins.  If Mr craquepoutte gets first, you lose.  That pawn is played at random after everyone has played.  Or play just plain snakes & ladders rules.

Viens vivre une aventure avec les personnages de la populaire série Toc Toc Toc !

Arrive le plus rapidement possible au nid de la Grubule pour la sauver du filet de Monsieur Craquepoutte ! Mais attention, tu rencontreras des obstacles sur ton chemin.

Le premier joueur à atteindre la case no.50 (le nid de la Grubule) est déclaré gagnant.

Name: Rollerball (future sport)
Description:
"The velocity of the ball, the awful physics of the track ... and in the middle of it all, men.  Playing by an odd set of rules. It's not a game man was supposed to grow strong in..."

Those of you who enjoyed the 1975 movie "Rollerball" will want to take a look at this re-creation of the violent future sport ... as a board game. You’ll have to use all the speed of the track to overcome your opponents and force your way through to the goal with that heartless steel ball.

Each player manages his team of skaters, catchers and bikers in an effort to score goals with the ball. Each member of the team is represented by a counter (or figure), with vital information recorded on a separate card. The speed of movement is recorded with a sliding clip on the side of the card, and adjusted turn by turn as the figures race around the track. The player must pull order out of chaos as his team struggles with opponents to control the ball and score goals.

The movement of figures is affected by the speed and agility of the figure. Complex manuevers, interactions with opposing figures (such as striking and checking) and handling the ball are resolved with dice rolls. As the game progresses, injuries and fatigue will reduce the effectiveness of the team, and play strategy includes decisions about protecting key figures and targeting particular opponents in this full contact sport.

Playing time is extremely long. This is a simulation game requiring book-keeping and attention to detail. Not for everyone.

Game variants allow modified game constraints such as "no penalties" or changes to the time limit.

Free to download from the files section below.

This is fan work. Title, words and images from the film are used without permission.

Name: Humans!!! 2: Sea Food
Description:
Twilight Creations is pleased to announce our first expansion for our popular Humans!!! line. Humans!!! 2: Sea Food is set on a naval base and features 16 new event cards, 16 new tiles, rules and 10 new zombie navy figure pawns with player card. Map Tile art is by Kurt Miller, and Event card art is by fan favorite David Aikins.

Part of the Zombies!!! series.

Name: Zombies!!! 9: Ashes to Ashes
Description:
It used to be one of the big two: 
You know what I mean, death and taxes. Now only taxes are certain and the graveyard might as well as be called a waiting room. "Final resting place," yeah right! Ain't no one resting here...

Zombies!!! 9 lets you explore your local cemetery and see if you can stop the source of the zombie scourge. What is that funny-smelling smoke coming from the crematorium, anyway?

This expansion for the Zombies!!! board game adds:

     16 new map tiles   
     32 new event cards featuring the new "Automatic" card type   
     25 zombie "kid" figures  
     Rules


Requires the Zombies!!! core set (TLC 2010) to play. Suggested for ages 13 and up.

Part of the Zombies!!! series.

Name: Byen Rundt
Description: It is, in all essentials based on the concept of Monopoly but apparently someone else must have owned the rights for the name. this is a copy of Monopoly make in Denmark in the 1930´s

Name: Tracktrick
Description:
This game is played with parts of two standard deck of cards and 18 poker chips or other counters. One each of A, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and Queen from one of the deck is arranged in a 3x3 grid with the Queen in the middle but otherwise randomly. These "scorecards" form the board.
The cards A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6 from the other deck are shuffled and each player is dealt 12 cards. They reveal one of them simultaneously. If two or three are of the same suit then that suit is trump. If all three are different then the trump suit is the fourth one - that is, the suit that nobody chose. However, if any two are of the same rank then the hand is played at no trump.
Then tricks are played, and at the end of the play players puts a counters on the scorecards representing the number of tricks they won (Queen represents 0). If it's occupied by an opponent's counter, return it to its owner and substitute one of your own, if two of you win the same number, and the appropriate scorecard is either blank or occupied by the third player, leave it unchanged.
You win a game by finishing with three counters in a row, whether horizontally, vertically or diagonally, after everyone has recorded their score. If two or all three players achieve this simultaneously, the winner is the player whose line of three cards has the highest total face value.

Name: Throps
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. It is a 3-player version of GOPS.
Each player is dealt 13 cards. The other cards are revealed one by one. Then every player chooses one card simultaneously and reveals it. The highest card wins the trick. In that case the same suit, or the same color, or the same parity (spades/hearts or clubs/diamonds) with the first revealed card wins. Then the next card is revealed.
After 13 tricks each player scores as follows for the cards they won: The face value of all cards of any one suit, minus the total face values of all other cards, plus 10 per void suit.
Then the game continues up to 100 points.

Name: Trigami
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. It is a 3-player version of Bugami. Nines, eights and sevens are removed to use as bid cards, and each player is dealt 13 cards, and also gets a bid card of each suit. They choose a bid card simultaneously and reveal it. That suit will be their bug suit. 
You also have the possibility to choose the (currently unknown) suit of the undealt card, for double points, or to announce that you will not take any card of your bug suit, also for double points, but if you cannot make it, you score nothing.
Then tricks are played (they are taken by the highest card of the suit led).
You each count 10 points for each trick you won, and divide this total by the number of bugs they contain, ignoring fractions. If there are no bugs, each trick counts double instead.
The first player to reach 500 points (after several deals), is the winner.


     Re-implements: Bugami

Name: Twyst
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. Each player is dealt 13 cards, and they simultaneously choose one of them to bid. These decide the contract, if there is a trump and the partnerships also.
Then tricks are played. You must follow suit if you can, and the trick is won by the highest trump (if any) or the highest card in the suit led. The winner of the trick leads the next.
Scores are kept individually and cumulatively, and can fall below zero. Players score depends on the number of tricks won, but basically is positive for winning the contract, negative for losing it, and 0 if they were not involved. (Depending on the bids, 1-4 players can be involved, maybe with different goals.)

Name: Who's who
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards, including two jokers but without twos, threes and fours. Each player is dealt 14 cards. The two players with the same number of jokers are partners, the third player is the soloist. But players do not know this until enough jokers are played.

The object of the soloist is either to win the middling number of tricks (for example, four if one partner wins five or more and the other three or fewer), or to force the partners to win the same number of tricks each. This means he can win with 14 tricks if they both win none, or with none if they both win seven.

Tricks are played and the trick is normally taken by the second-highest card of the suit led, or by the leader if nobody follows suit.

If a Joker is played, its player may decide who wins the trick. If both are played at the same trick, the soloist decide who takes the trick. Jokers cannot be led unless there are no other cards in hand.

The score is always 10 points plus the number of tricks won by the soloist (making anything from 10 to 24 points). This amount is credited to the soloist if successful, otherwise to each partner.

Name: Priests of Stonehenge
Description:
Epic building in Ancient Britain.

Players control small clans near 2 mounds -- within one they shall construct a Burial Complex for their High King, and on top of the other Stonehenge shall rise and Druids shall gather there to bless the land.  To accomplish this players need to feed their population and master the Wheel.  Those that do so shall earn glory in this life and beyond.

Name: Clue: The Card Game – Mystery at Sea
Description:
From the box:

The famous clue suspects are all aboard Mr. Boddy's luxury yacht sailing to parts unknown. One will become a victim of foul play. What room of the yacht did the murder take place, which weapon was used, and who did it?

Was it Colonel Mustard in the galley with the oar? Or Miss Scarlet on the sun deck with the scarf? (This time, Mr. Boddy could even be the guilty party!).

Just as in the CLUE board game, you'll use a detective note sheet to track information. Action cards pace the game and provide many ways to get clues.

Be the first to figure out Who? Where? Which weapon? and you'll solve the mystery and win the game!
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Lords of Winter
Description:
Prepare for a long winter. Lords of Winter, the latest deluxe expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, will take the cold honor of House Stark to new heights this spring!

The Lords of Winter expansion contains 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards), including Eddard and Catelyn Stark, Winterfell, and “The King of the North,” Robb Stark. Players of other houses will also find a wealth of new strategies, tactics, and deck-building options.

Finally, as an introduction to the art of customizing a deck, Lords of Winter offers deck lists for two exciting theme decks, one featuring the Tullys of Riverrun, and the other featuring the Direwolves of the North.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Luppen
Description:
Travel friendly trivia game from Finland in Swedish for any number of players. The questions are geographical.
The pocket sized box contains a couple of hundreds cards. Each card has one answer and four questions with decreasing difficulty and point value. Answering the question at the hardest level gives 4 points, at the easiest 1 point. A game goes to an beforehand decided total e.g. 20.

Name: The Orchard
Description:
An orchard is an artificially cultivated land where fruit trees are grown mainly to serve as human food.

The orchard has a variety of fruit species found but in particular apples, pears and cherries.

The high harvest costs, the difficult years and disease control make fruit trees fall into disuse.

Overview
You're a fruit farmer who harvests fruit (apples, pears and cherries) from a common orchard, where you struggle with fellow growers to meet the specific demand of the market to harvest healthier, tastier and better quality fruit.

Good fruit is scarce, harvesting expensive and not enough ladders available but only fruit growers know how to preserve fruit quality even when fruit tree abandonment takes place due to difficult years.

As a fruit grower you need to make sure that the quality of your fruit will be rated as high as possible and need to keep fruit harvesting costs under control.

Name: At the Cinema
Description:
Get the best seating areas in the cinema by driving fellow moviegoers from their seats. If the cinema is full, the movie starts and the game is ended.

Every moviegoer is with a group of people who all prefer to sit on the best seating areas together. The cinema hall is divided into good, fair, and poor seating areas.

You need to ensure the best seating areas to be reached before the room is full, but note you also get points for the largest group sitting together.

Name: Wu Xing
Description:
Wu Xing is the doctrine of the 5 elements named fire, water, earth, metal and wood.

Each player need to get as many element chips as possible.

You get elements chips of your played card, comparing each time the cards next to eachother whether they destroy or create elements.

There are playing cards in range from 1-9 (2x) for each element.

Sets of all elements (all 5) will earn you 5 points, metal/wood/earth 2 points, fire/water/earth 2 points, fire/water 1 point and metal/wood 1 point.

You play in turns by placing a card from your hand on your own board or on a board of a fellow player on the first free card space. Each player get a board with room for 4 cards.

A round exist out of playing all cards (4 for each player). Three rounds need to decide who gain the most points for the collected element chips.

Element creation
Fire creates Earth
Earth bears Metal
Metal carries Water
Water nourishes Wood
Wood feeds Fire

Element Destruction
Fire melts Metal
Metal chops Wood
Wood parts Earth
Earth absorbs Water
Water quenches Fire

Name: Meatball Madness
Description:
From the manufacturer:

How long will it take for you to get all three meatballs from the cook's pot onto the customer's plate of spaghetti? Meatball Madness is a game of speed and skill! Use the air-powered ladle to float meatballs through the kitchen-themed obstacle course. The three obstacles can be placed as close or as far apart and as high and low as you want. You control the level of difficulty. Don't drop the meatball because you'll need to go back to start! The built-in timer indicates each player's time. The player who is the fastest wins!

Name: Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel
Description: Based on a popular Belgian TV-show, Plop Grabbelpaddenstoel is a game like Bingo. Players try to be the first to complete their scorecard by drawing cards (items) from a cardboard toadstool. The amount of cards you draw is determined by dice-roll. Special cards may let you take another turn or have you clear your scorecard.

Name: 2012: The Day of Fallout
Description:
2012: The Day of Fallout
Tactical game for 2-4 players

Lead one of four armies: Human Section 8, Arkanian alien race, Triad and CyberZona. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- choose Orders Card
- move or attack opponents
- use Strategic Command Card's

Scenarios:
- standard deathmatch for 2-4 players,
- cooperative deathmatch
- capture the flag,
- capture the region,
- escort unit,
- defend region/s
and more.

Victory is achieved by:
- implementation scenarios, or
- collecting victory points, or
- destruction of all enemy units on board

Game in Polish language version.

In box:
- 25 pieces of the map (modular board)
- 60 cards of Army (15 for each army)
- 24 cards for Strategic Action
- 16 cards of Orders (4 for each army)
- 12 cards of Teams (3 for each army)
- 5 card - walls
- 3 cards - flags
- 20 bases
- 2 dices
- 1 rulebook

Game Designer: Åukasz S. Kowal
Art designers: Åukasz S. Kowal, Agnieszka Kowal
Publisher: Essencegame

Essencegame.com

Name: Polska 1939
Description:
1939 marks the twilight of greatest conflict in human history. All started on September 1st 1939 in Poland when German army launched its first strike. This campaign was to prove German warfare superiority and be quick and easy "walk to Warsaw". It wasn't that quick and easy though as defeating Poland took Germans the same amount of time they needed for France - even with help of Soviet backstab on September 17th.

Game allows to play full campaign in Poland. Map covers Polish territory in 1939 and supplies full Polish, German and Soviet forces that were involved in the region. Additional Slovakia, Lithuania and Romania units that could potentially be involved are in the set as well.

There are 2 scenarios in the game: German assault on September 1st and Polish counter at Bzura river. On http://www.taktykaistrategia.pl you can get more including hipotetic conflict USSR vs. Poland (based on Polish plan "EAST") and others.

Number of scenarios was published in Taktyka i Strategia magazine:
- Plan "Zachód" (No. 34)
- Plan Porwita (No. 35)
- 17 WrzeÅ›nia (No. 33)
- Linia WisÅ‚y (No. 32)
- Atak na Prusy Wschodnie (No. 31)
- Plan "Wschód" (No. 30)

Name: Battle of Britain: The Hardest Day
Description:
The British aviation magazine, to celebrate the 50 years from the Battle of Britain, decided to offer to its readers a wargame.
In the introduction of the rules it is so descibed:
"BATTLE OF BRITAIN: THE HARDEST DAY recreates the events of 18 August 1940, the day during the Battle when the greatest number of aircraft were destroyed and damaged on either side.
Contestants are the senior Fighter Controller at 11 Group of Fighter Command, on the British side and the senior operational officer at Luftflotte 2 of the Lutwaffe, on the German side. For authenticity, in the game each of side uses the exact forces available to it on 18 August, bombers and fighters move across the map at the same rate as did the real aircraft during the Battle and each contestant has operational orders and directives similar to those of his real counterpart during this phase of the Battle of Britain. The players control pieces representing each British fighter squadron, and forces from each German bomber and fighter Geschwader, in their struggle for air superiority over the vitally important south eastern corner of England. The rules of the game have been carefully worked out to present a series of actions remarkably close to those actually fought during the Battle of Britain. With tactical skill and element of good fortune, either side can win. Devised by Dr. Alfred Price and Mike Spick."
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Bumba Circusspel
Description: Roll the die and find your way through Bumba's circus. This educational game teaches small children about colours and letter-sounds. Based on the popular Belgian children's TV-show

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Murmurs of Evil Asylum Pack
Description:
Erin Morai, a troubled but dedicated biology student, found herself strangely attracted to Tyler Scindere... which is why she agreed to follow him in the first place. Now, lured into darkness, will she retain her composure, and her very sanity, long enough to save herself?

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of the second Asylum Pack in The Yuggoth Contract cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game!

Murmurs of Evil is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

Also included in this cycle is part two of a gripping new short story by Nate French. In the last installment, Tyler Scindere found himself trapped in perpetual darkness and suffering. Now, we meet Erin Morai, a brilliant college student. Erin might be Tyler’s greatest enemy... and his only hope.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game – Asylum Packs Set 3 (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Esians
Description:
Bad days have come... New perils arise where the Evil was uprooted, and the world of Esians is becoming dark and savage once again. Only fortitude and courage can turn the tide to bring back the good times of old.
Do you dare to explore the unknown regions? Will you brave the ever-present dangers - and survive?

Esians is a small and portable card game of fantasy adventures, designed primarily as a solitaire, but it can accomodate up to three players in either cooperative or competitive mode. On their journey through the lands of Esians players seek out adventures, encouter friends and foes (the latter being more the case) and reap rewards or recieve punishment.

Name: Rhinopedia
Description:
A roll and move game based on trivia answers to questions about rhinoceroses.  Sort of like Trivial Pursuit - if every topic was rhinoceros.

From the box:

"The rhinos are stampeding!  Be the first rhino to reach home by your superior rhinowledge."

Name: Limn
Description:
Limn is a balderdash style party game for four to ten players.

Each player gets a few pages from newspapers and/or magazines and clips words or phrases that could describe each one of the other players from these papers.  When everyone has chosen phrases for all the players, the clippings are randomized and the players guess who clipped the phrases and who is being described.  Players score points for correct guesses.

Name: Horde Runners
Description:
From the online rule page:
Two opposing forces wage a war of the minds as the attempt to steal the "horde" of the other team.  Each side has four "thieves" that are attempting to retrieve the treasure of the other team.

Find rules at: http://www.icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Horde_Runners

This Icehouse game requires four Icehouse sets, a chess board and one die.  This capture the flag style game for two players has players trying to sneak treasures out of their opponent's stockpiles.  The first player to bring three pieces of treasure back to the home base is the winner!

Name: We All Scream for Ice Cream
Description: Kid's game recommended for ages 5 to 10 years. Can be played by 2 or more players. Play individually, or in teams. Spin the spinner to see how many ice cream scoops you need to place on your cone, and to find out if you get to stand on two feet, or have to balance on just one. The first player or team to stack 7 scoops without dropping any of them wins.

Name: Because It's There!
Description:
This game is FREE Print And Play.

From the web page:

Because It's There is not really a war game, but it is a conflict simulation in which man challenges nature in an attempt to be the first to scale the world's highest mountain peak. This is a solitaire game in which the player assumes the role of the leader of an expedition on Mount Everest. Cards represent actual climbers from the ill-fated 1924 British expedition, the successful 1953 British expedition, and the first successful American expedition of 1963.

Name: Game of Inventions
Description: The purpose of the game is to educate players about the most up to date inventions (of the time) and their inventors. Up to 10 can play. Each player gets a card with 5 inventors listed on it. There is a pile of cards with inventions listed on them, and the goal of the game is to claim inventions that belong to the inventors shown on your card. The winner is the one who first completes his card correctly.

Name: Hexenduell
Description:
from poeppelkiste.de:

One player uses magnetic force & an ornery witches broom to move his magic crystals across the board and into the cauldron. At the same time, another player rolls dice as the Guardian of Time in order to stop the player turn. Whoever gets four crystals in first wins the game.

from HABA website:
All the witches have gathered for the duel with the jinxed broom Mumbo Jumbo. Each one tries to tame the flying broom and make it sweep their magic gems into the cauldron. However, only the one who has a magic touch with the witch's magnetic power will be the first to be able to sweep his magic gems into the cauldron.

Name: Mekawing
Description:
FREE Print & Play version available in spanish and english:
Spanish Version: https://goo.gl/MnCGkW
English Version: http://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/144392/Mekawing-Z--Open-Set

It's been centuries since Humanity left the Earth after exhausting all its natural resources. Escaping to the stars was Humanity's solution, settling in space colonies all around the Solar System. Under the banner of Corpnations, the new post-Humanity has forgotten almost everything form its time on Earth, only having to turn back as a strange energy grows in their old home planet...

Mekawing is a Mecha Tactical Board Game in which two opposing wings battle each other in different scenarios.

Providing a total Cinematic Experience, Mekawing mixes the detail of miniature gaming, and the action/counter-action of card gaming to create a unique gaming experience. This is done with both wing creation and deck construction rules and mechanics.

Each player picks their Ace pilots which provide Wing Points from which they buy mechs - Mekas - for their wings. Players have three factions to play, each faction providing a selection of meka types and equipment configurations; focusing on melee combat, ranged combat, or special support.

Additionally, each player builds his/her own Duel decks with cards that show each meka's fighting style, and Upgrade cards that grant special actions and abilities to their Mekas, provide bonuses and/or create special battle situations; giving each wing its own tactics and strategies.

During play, players choose a scenario, build the map using terrain tiles, and use their mekas to gain control of the battleground using their meka's equipment and Action Cards.

Want to now the story behind Mekawing? go to https://mekawing.wordpress.com/2015/04/28/ficcion-mekawing-regimen-de-la-colmena-wan-yang/ (content in spanish).

Name: Dobbelsteen Spelletjes
Description:
On the cover: 
Dobbelsteen Spelletjes including instructions for 26 different dice games.

Included are instructions for different dice games with 1,2,3,5 and 6 dice, a dice cup and 6 dice.

Games with 1 die: Jule, To and From, Add and Subtract, 21st One, Fifteen, The Big Heart, Game of Sixes

Games with 2 dice: Heaven and Eart, The Happy 7, The crossed 12, Eleven, Dice Game

Games with 3 dice: Blue Eyes, Chicago, Chicago High-Low, Succession, Double, Double Lotje, Game of tens, Two is One, From 1 till 16

Games with 5 dice: Big Bank, Dice Poker

Games with 6 dice: Three times a pair, The angry 7, Ohio

Name: Troll
Description:
Troll is a two player game played on an empty 8x8 square board.
Each player owns two opposite edges.
Each player drops one of his stones on an empty cell.
If at least one opponent stone is between that stone and another friendly stone,then all opponent stones that were between those stones flip its color.
Wins the player who managers to do a path connecting his two opposite edges.

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Highland Expansion
Description:
From the publisher (Fantasy Flight Games):

Legends say all magic in the land comes from an enchanted stream that flows from the tallest mountain. Atop the tallest peaks, the magical waters are at their most pure and potent, and the banks are littered with precious gems. But one must beware, for within the Highland dwells the feared Eagle King, guardian of the source of magic. Intruders and fortune-seekers will receive no mercy, for he has not forgotten that jewels stolen from him now adorn the Crown of Command itself!

Talisman: The Highland adds a new Region to the game for heroes to explore. A custom-fitted map board and over 100 new cards bring this mountainous realm vividly to life, while six brand-new characters, each represented with a superbly detailed plastic miniature, offer fantastic new playing experiences. Climb as high as you dare, and lay claim to the unimaginable wealth that awaits atop the tallest peak in the world of Talisman!

Name: Zombie Chess
Description:
User Summary:

Zombie Chess (A.K.A. The Case Against Humanity Winning the Zombie War) is a chess variant in which one player's chess pieces are replaced by plastic zombies.  It will be the task of the "humans" to eliminate the zombie threat, which in itself is not a terrible task, but is made more complicated by the fact that, while battling the zombies, the "humans" can become infected, and also that the zombie ranks tend to replenish. Die rolls determine whether pieces become infected or destroyed, when one takes another.

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Crown of Command
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games has made a couple of bonus Alternative Endings available via the Talisman Support Pages.

Alternative Endings were introduced in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Frostmarch Expansion and will no doubt feature more as new expansions are released.

The Crown of Command Ending is a copy of the original game ending, for those who would like to include it if randomly choosing an Ending.

Of course, you will require the card back which is also available on the Talisman Support Page!

Name: Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise
Description:
Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise (The Corn Circles/The Crop Circles), the seventh official mini-expansion for Carcassonne, consists of six tiles depicting corn circles made from corn stalks. A corn circle tile allows a player to place a second follower on a feature that they have already claimed, or to return an already-placed follower to his supply.

Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise first appeared in Germany as a bonus expansion shrinkwrapped to the Carcassonne base game, and was later available directly from the publisher Hans im Glück.

A second set of six Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise (Carcassonne: Corn Circles II) tiles come packaged in six mini-expansions for Carcassonne – one tile per expansion – released by Hans im Glück and 999 Games. These tiles can be used on their own or combined with the tiles from the first Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise expansion. Part of the Carcassonne series.

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Danse Macabre
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games has made a couple of bonus Alternative Endings available via the Talisman Support Pages.

Alternative Endings were introduced in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Frostmarch Expansion and will no doubt feature more as new expansions are released.

Danse Macabre is an Ending which requires Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion as it features the Grim Reaper himself from the expansion.

Of course, you will require the card back which is also available on the Talisman Support Page!

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Instructor
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Instructor Adventure card is a Stranger originally included in the Talisman: The Adventure for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar Place card was released as an Adventure card called the Academy in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Doppelganger
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Doppelganger Adventure card is an Enemy - Monster originally included in the Talisman: Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar card was released as a Dungeon card called the Mimic in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Dungeon Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.

Name: Talisman (4th Edition): Arena
Description:
Black Industries produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as when people ordered Talisman: Revised 4th Edition from the BI website.

The Arena Adventure card was a Place originally included in the Talisman: Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card was never produced in another expansion under Black Industries, it did see mainstream publication for the Revised version of Talisman: Revised 4th Edition under Fantasy Flight Games in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.

Name: Talisman (4th Edition): Rod of Ruin
Description:
Black Industries produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as when people ordered Talisman: Revised 4th Edition from the BI website.

The Rod of Ruin Adventure card was a Magic Object originally included in the Talisman: Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card was never produced in another expansion under Black Industries, it did see mainstream publication for the Revised version of Talisman: Revised 4th Edition under Fantasy Flight Games in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.

Name: Right Ascension
Description:
New colonies need many things to survive... tools, food, raw materials, medicine, to name a few. Merchants and the ships they use to ply the stars are their salvation in many ways. You are one of those merchants. You are charged with ensuring that you are not only profitable, but you are keeping these new colonies alive and thriving in this backwater part of the galaxy.

You also have competitors... others who wish to attract the attention of the Emperor by being the best. You must struggle to supply systems with goods at a profit. You must also struggle to gain influence through your trade in key systems that will attract future rewards from the Emperor himself. But options are limited... you don’t hear of deliveries when needed and your opponents do.

You are beset with a changing political landscape in this sector as colonies grow. Demand for certain goods shifts like sand. Danger and discovery await. Your network of informants and insiders provide you with information. As time passes, it becomes harder to trade safely as success attracts attention — sometimes from unsavory characters. The finest merchants rise to this challenge, but they are ever-mindful of not making the Emperor jealous...

THIS is life in Right Ascension...

Name: Middleman
Description:
Middleman is an Icehouse game for two players.  Middleman is like a 3D version of chess, where each piece has different movement rules.  Large pieces move like bishops; medium pieces move like rooks; small pieces move like knights.  The large and medium pieces are restricted to moving one or two spaces.  The first player to form a tree of his or her own color pieces wins the game.

Middleman is played on a diamond sized chess board with a size of six squares across the middle.  This diagram shows the board shape where the Xes represent the the playing surface of the board.

00XX00
0XXXX0
XXXXXX
XXXXXX
0XXXX0
00XX00

For a full description of the rules see http://www.icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Middleman

Name: Five Little Monkeys Can't Catch Me Game
Description:
From the manufacturer: Watch Out! It's not nice to tease a crocodile...players try to cross the creek and avoid the dangerous snap of the crocodile. The first player to make it all the way around wins the game!

For 2 - 4 players, ages 3 and up.

Contents: 1 game board, 8 monkey pieces, 1 snapping crocodile, 1 spinner card and instructions

Name: Ni Hao Kai-Lan Dragon Boat Race Game
Description: A spin and move race game for 2 to 4 players ages 3 and up. Be the first to win 3 races. Winner gets to wear the dragon mask and lead the Dragon Boat Festival Parade.

Name: Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game
Description:
Everybody is dead.

Okay, you’re still alive, but almost everybody else is dead. And the dead aren’t really dead, they’re un-dead, they’re hungry and they’re coming for YOU!

Can you survive a zombie apocalypse? Find out with The Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game!

The game includes six sheets of die-cut markers, equipment and vehicle pieces, an 11x17” cardstock playing board, an 8½ x 11” battle board, a complete rulebook and a survivor’s guide to the apocalypse with encounter charts and scrounging tables for all the locations on the board. Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

Players can work separately or cooperate as they try to survive to reach the zombie-free sanctuary. (If it really is zombie-free.) Players battle hordes of the undead, plus escaped criminals, redneck cannibals, rampaging marauders, corporate security goons, government troops and (maybe) each other for the food, fuel, equipment, weapons and ammo necessary to survive the zombie apocalypse.

It’s all here from every zombie movie you’ve ever seen: chainsaws, kukri, shotguns, the armored bus, the shopping mall, the farmhouse, secret underground lab, and more! Play against your choice of fast (28 Days Later-style) zombies or “classic” zombies.

The game play is fast and furious with combat almost every turn. May be played solitaire or with up to ten players. If you’re killed you just lose all your equipment and start over as somebody else. A great party game!

Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

You can buy on-line at www.fantasynations.com/

Name: Rugrats Party Whooper
Description:
From Nickelodeon. "A matching game for young party-goers!"

"The object of the game is race to Finish Space and be the first to claim the party gift which awaits."

A Rugrats themed remake of Candy Land manufactured in the Philippines. 2-6 players move their tokens along the track according to the results of a spinner device. Players do not move space by space but from their current space to the next space as indicated by the spinner. The spinner has five possible segments; forward, backward, cake, balloon and gift. First player to reach the end of the track wins.

Name: Kaj & Andrea på Spilopper
Description:
From the publisher:
Have a lots of fun with the naughty frog and the nice parrot - Kaj & Andrea. Game gives you many entertaining challenges! This game is made for the funniest disciplines. Can you example. stand on one leg and say, as a hen, or are you really good at flying? There are sure plenty of entertainment in this enjoyable game with both known and beloved characters from the television.
Children will try to do as their favorite TV character do on the cards! The first who get 10 of those card by doing right things needed, will win!

Name: Let's learn the Calendar
Description: The children are shown a card which has a date on it. The child who can find the correct day on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the date the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what day it is.

Name: Let's Learn the Professions
Description: The children are shown a card which has a profession on it. The child who can find the correct tool of that proffesion on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the professions the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what tool it uses.

Name: Hop på toget: Danmark rundt
Description:
From the publisher:
Train Pillet is a traditional family game where players travel around Denmark crisscrossing and get interesting experiences in different cities. In this exciting game you must compete to be first submitted to the various stations. To change trains entails some risk, and bonus cards affect the game.
You win by getting through your given cities fastest!

Name: City of The Dead
Description:
It’s all gone to hell! You're a survivor, but there’s something you gotta do before you get out of town! Maybe it’s finding your husband, helping the guys from your precinct defend the hospital, getting your family to a safe zone or reporting for duty at the base.

On your own you're toast so maybe you'll hook up with some other survivors along the way, strength in numbers and all that. Maybe they'll help out, pull some strings with whoever is still out there to pull strings with. Don't forget the cops are out in force, hopefully they'll hold off the horde until the national guard get here or you could always give 'em a hand!

Can you make a last stand, unite the people of your town and hold back the tide of undead? Will you evacuate city blocks before they get infected? Can you get them to safezones or are you leading them into a trap? Will you lead the army or the police in counterattacks or try to figure out the cause of the threat with CDC? Will you help rally the townspeople and defeat the source of the zombies or leave ‘em to rot and get out of dodge with whatever and whoever you can find?

- Current Summary from the Designer
- This game is currently in development by the designer to be published through new imprint MODIPHIUS.

Name: X
Description:
X is a simple game for 3 players which employs an ordinary rhombus board with a hexagonal pattern of cells.  The three players, Red, Yellow and Green, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board.  A corner of the rhombus is claimed by the player with the outermost path connecting the corner's two adjacent sides.

The object is to claim the maximum unique number of corners.

Name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Rommel
Description: Rommel is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as motorized infantry. His special abilites allow him to move twice or move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.

Name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Patton
Description: Patton is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as Armor. His special abilites allow him to move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.

Name: Nak
Description:
From the Back of the Box:

The object of the game is to reach the score of 21.  Each player gets to flick three NAK pieces.  The first player reaching the score of 21 or more is the winner.  A set of dice adds to the fun and excitement.  To complete the challenge and skill of the game there are two additional holes in the board, a pink hole and a blue hole; the hopes and hazards of each player.  For these holes there are two sets of cards, a pink set and a blue set.  Each time a player's NAK piece falls into either of these holes the corresponding card is selected and the special instructions are followed.

Name: Rock'n Reptiles
Description:
From the Back of the Box:

Join your friends in a thrilling, exciting and fun race through Rock'n Reptiles.  Simplified play for young children with easy to follow instructions.

User Summary:

Players take turns spinning a coloured spinner and moving their playing piece to the closest space with the colour shown (very much like Candyland).  When a player first passes one of the eight marked locations, they take the corresponding location card.  There is only one card for each location.  The player with the most location cards by the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Nashville in a Box
Description:
Monopoly-type game depicting locations in Nashville, Tennessee.

1 x game board
6 x metal playing pieces
32 x skyline sections
12 x keys to the city
15 x big fun cards
15 x contingency cards
28 x Deed cards
1 x pack of money;
- $1, $5, $10, $20, $50, $100 and $500
2 x dice
1 x rules booklet

Buy property, build a skyline, trade for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough but add a traffic jam, property taxes, car fines and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun.
Families: Series: ... in a Box (Late for the Sky)

Name: Hofnar
Description: A partygame where the challenge is building words letter by letter. Example: When the first player spins the spinner and gets the letter "B" he thinks of a word (board), so now he says out loud the second letter in that word "O", the next player now builds on from those two letters, but thinks of another word (Boulder) and says out loud the next letter in that word "U". Etc. Play continues until a player cannot add a letter or only has the option to add the final letter to make a complete word.

Name: Let's Play Vegas
Description:
Las Vegas Style "Let's Play Vegas"
The Non-Stop Game of Skill, Chance and Action Among Players.

Players start out on a track that is ment to be the "strip" and "fremont street" as you work your way from arrival, back to the airport to leave. ALong the way you land on spaces that allow you to gamble and proform other actions. The player with the most cash at the end wins!

Name: Additions: Soustractions
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

The game contains:

* A 40 pages rule book with the rules for 12 games, including game samples
    * 32 playing cards
    * All that in a metal box

12 games to teach progressively substraction and addition.

Using well known game designs: Rummy, Old Maid, War and variants using the "Mistigri" card and the "Cameleon" card.
Whoever owns The "Mistigri" loses the game.
WIle the "Cameleon" card acts as a wild card.

Name: Plunk A Skunk
Description:
"Looking to get out a little pent-up aggression but don't feel like destroying your flatware? Plunk-A-Skunk is for you. Fans of the Whack-A-Mole carnival game found on Jersey Shore boardwalks will be familiar with this game's manic bonking action. As each of the skunk heads on the playing field light up you have to ding them with the padded Plunk-A-Skunk mallet to score points. Bang away and skunks taunt and praise you with phrases like "Time is running out" and "You're awesome."

Electronic game, home variant of the popular arcade/funfair game where small creatures (usually crocodiles or gophers) pop in and out of holes in the board, and the players score points by hitting ("plunking") them with inflatable mallets. This variant uses skunk faces that randomly light up; the player scores points by hitting a skunk face when it is illuminated.

Mildly amusing fun, with limited replay value, and fresh batteries are a must.
